thread.title: After A Day Of High Drama And Chaos, Palaniswami Sails Through The Trust Vote In Tamil Nadu - Indiatimes.com
thread.title_full: After A Day Of High Drama And Chaos, Palaniswami Sails Through The Trust Vote In Tamil Nadu - Indiatimes.com

title: After A Day Of High Drama And Chaos, Palaniswami Sails Through The Trust Vote In Tamil Nadu - Indiatimes.com
text:
Bobins Abraham February 18, 2017 
Make no mistake about it, this was a shameful day for democracy inside the Tamil Nadu assembly. The house witnessed utterly chaotic scenes including protest, gharao and some MLAs being manhandled. 
ANI 
Amid all the chaos and confusion Edappadi K Palaniswami, the nominee of now jailed AIADMK general secretary Sasikala managed to win the trust vote in the assembly. 
BCCL 
This, after the speaker, evicted all DMK MLAs for creating a ruckus in the house earlier in the day. The Congress and IUML had also walked out of the vote, leaving just AIADMK MLAs for the vote. 
Of these, 122 voted for Palaniswami while 11 MLAs from the Panneerselvam camp voted against. The number needed for a simple majority in the 234 member house was 116. 
The trust vote means Palaniswami, a proxy of Sasikala is safe for at least six months from now, under normal circumstances. 
Reacting to the trust vote, Panneerselvam said the vote was undemocratic. He also hit out at the Sasikala camp saying that now the state will be ruled by someone Jayalalithaa had said she won't have in the party in her lifetime. 
BCCL 
Earlier, in the day the assembly witnessed unprecedented scenes after the OPS camp, Congress and the DMK demanded a secret vote, to which the speaker said no. 
Although the media was denied access to the proceedings in the Assembly, visuals of chaos were later telecast on television channels. Don't Miss
